commit_message:
[WIP] Updated role using the Multi-Distro framework

* The default apt packages have been moved into a var file
  that is only loaded when the detected OS is matched.
* The Install task file has had the apt specific tasks moved
  into a named install task file.
* The iptables checksum fix script is now conditional on the distro
* The creation of the upstart scripts is now dependent on distro version
* LBaaS scripts location can be updated based on the distro version

Implements: blueprint multi-platform-host

Change-Id: Ie46146ce9051695d769b075d291b9fb429531e7d
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

Change-Id: I6e88b611568cca5110c28a51eae59e1427f12081
"}]
commit_message:
keystone-manage doctor

At the summit, I'm constantly hearing about deployment opinions that the
community wants to make to the broader community, but we don't have a
direct way to make those suggestions.

Change-Id: I6e88b611568cca5110c28a51eae59e1427f12081
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/09/310309/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================== keystone-manage doctor ====================== `bp keystone-manage-doctor <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/keystone-manage-doctor>`_ To provide a better deployer experience, let's provide a tool that deployers can run to validate the state of a deployment and immediately receive comprehensive feedback on suggested changes with detailed explanations. Problem Description =================== As upstream developers, operators, and summit attendees, many of us carry tribal knowledge of various aspects of configuration that we recommend to other deployers. We currently share that knowledge widely via documentation and blog posts, which not all operators read. We also log deprecation warnings at runtime. - Are you using a deprecated configuration option? - Is there an ``identity`` endpoint in your service catalog? Does it have a versioned endpoint? If so, which version? - Does the ``is_admin_project`` you specified in ``keystone.conf`` actually exist in the backend? - Does the ``default_domain_id`` you specified in ``keystone.conf`` actually exist in the backend? Proposed Change =============== Implement a new ``keystone-manage`` called ``doctor``. ``keystone-manage doctor`` should diagnose issues with your deployment and make detailed recommendations to resolve any issues. Alternatives ------------ Keep preaching. Security Impact --------------- This command could be used to reveal security issues with a deployment. Notifications Impact -------------------- None. Other End User Impact --------------------- End users are not be able to use ``keystone-manage`` (only deployers). Performance Impact ------------------ Running the command could place load on the keystone deployment, as it iterates through large datasets looking for issues. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None. Developer Impact ---------------- Similar to release notes, developers and code reviewers will need to be aware of changes that should result in new checks that ``doctor`` should perform. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: - dolph Work Items ---------- - Implement a no-op ``doctor`` command that doesn't actually perform any checks. - Implement a set of checks for ``doctor`` to perform (perhaps some or all of those described in the Problem Description section above). Dependencies ============ None. Documentation Impact ==================== Operators should be made aware of the command's availability via release notes and in openstack-manuals. References ========== None.

commit_message:
Taskflow update exposed inconsistencies in tasks

The new taskflow exposed areas we forgot to update
the revert method with the correct object data.

Taskflow now validates the revert data which exposed
those inconsistencies in the project

Change-Id: I319d59b345aab07784ae4dba19e0ffb7fbba0b04
Closes-Bug: #1581615

commit_message:
Skip SLO-reconciling probe test when SLO is off

The probe test in question tries to make a manifest referencing
unavailable objects and expects that to fail with a 400. If the SLO
middleware is enabled, then it checks the segments, can't find some,
and returns the 400. If it's disabled, the PUT succeeds and makes an
object whose contents are some JSON blob. In the latter case, the
probe test would fail because it expected a real SLO manifest but
didn't find one.

Now we skip the remainder of the test when we detect that SLO is not
enabled.

Change-Id: I3e7e8e98107608e675efc24156e703bc167458bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/98/312698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else: raise SkipTest("SLO not enabled in proxy; " "can't test manifest reconciliation")

commit_message:
[DEBUG] Bump Tempest version

Latest Devstack is not compatible with Tempest version
used by Manila after merge of commit [1].
Therefore, bump Tempest's version and fix incompatibilities
with plugin.

commit_message:
[DEBUG][Fix CI] Bump Tempest version

We are forced to bump version of Tempest because of regular
introduced incompatibility.
Also, add compatibility fixes to Manila plugin for
latest Tempest version.

Change-Id: I1b28a519ce84f6c6a6b3934fa556b6a0ba7e9264
Closes-Bug: #1568785

commit_message:
Move to falcon middleware

Instead of using the now removed hook feature of falcon, let's use
the middleware feature.

NOTE: Though the test is changed. But actually it's not correct since
the unicode test with a running zaqar server will return 404 instead
of 400. But it's out of the scope of this fix. Will fix it in a
following patch.

Co-Authored-By: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>

Closes-Bug: #1581189
Change-Id: I7e8e97b73ec3e245580f07e62442caf0395d5745
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/37/315737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class FuncMiddleware(object): def __init__(self, func): self.func = func def process_resource(self, req, resp, resource, params): return self.func(req, resp, params) middleware = [FuncMiddleware(hook) for hook in self.before_hooks] self.app = falcon.API(middleware=middleware)

commit_message:
Add note about service provider fields

Both auth_url and sp_url must follow a URL regex,
otherwise a 400 will be returned by keystone.

Change-Id: I212ab74178c68bce86f3669873ea8908db00223e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/71/303471/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Note: register a service provider with invalid URL values in the `auth_url` or `sp_url` fields will result in a HTTP ``400 Bad Request``. This is true also for empty values, since these fields are mandatory. - Note: updating a service provider with invalid URL values in the `auth_url` or `sp_url` fields will result in a HTTP ``400 Bad Request``. This is true also for empty values, since these fields are mandatory.

commit_message:
Make sure Ansible tests only use cirros images

It's possible enabling OpenStack things can cause other images other
than cirros to be made available (looking at you Magnum). We should
make sure our Ansible tests only look for Cirros.

Change-Id: Iefc01f8033629937552861366b9ddaac8058b249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/99/316099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IMAGE=`openstack --os-cloud=${CLOUD} image list -f value -c Name | grep cirros | grep -v -e ramdisk -e kernel`
deleted_lines: IMAGE=`openstack --os-cloud=${CLOUD} image list -f value -c Name | grep -v -e ramdisk -e kernel`

subject: create early_create phase
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 12:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['grenade.sh', 'projects/50_neutron/resources.sh', 'PLUGINS.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/grenade/commit/ae1837e18da9da155bb9d2bac2cc4dbfd4c17a2f', 'message': 'create early_create phase

For projects that need to setup custom networking we need an
early_create phase that has only gotten the base neutron network setup
which they can then work with and make changes as appropriate.

Create this new hook point, and move the neutron create to this early
phase.

Change-Id: Ifb1903f8d3cb11bc4db33f8acdea342e6373f864
'}]
commit_message:
create early_create phase

For projects that need to setup custom networking we need an
early_create phase that has only gotten the base neutron network setup
which they can then work with and make changes as appropriate.

Create this new hook point, and move the neutron create to this early
phase.

Change-Id: Ifb1903f8d3cb11bc4db33f8acdea342e6373f864
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/01/315501/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - resources.sh early_create creates a set of sample resources that should survive very early in the upgrade process. This should only be used for horizontal resources that impact other services, that *have* to be available before they do any of their setup. For instance setup of neutron networks. Do not use the phase unless you really know why ``create`` will not work for you.

commit_message:
Correct attribute name in TestListBayModel

Since Baymodel fields are always expanded as of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314799/3, updating name of attribute
_expand_baymodel_attrs to _baymodel_attrs in tests.

Closes-Bug: #1581364

* add dispatch functions to handle the function name collisions between lib/neutron

Usage of the new library is by setting the following in ENABLED_SERVICES

* neutron-api
* neutron-l3
* neutron-agent
* neutron-dhcp
* neutron-metadata-agent

For now, the new neutron library supports just the ML2 plugin. Ideally
different neutron plugins would become DevStack plugins. Work needs to
be done in this commit to make that possible, since there are lots of
configuration options that need to be set prior to the start of
neutron-api and other services.

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>

'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2015-11-06 19:29:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/f452e03269e297785d80f62a96235417c406d90e', 'message': 'Begin new lib/neutron

* minor tweaks to lib/template
* add new lib/neutron
* begin fleshing out the functions requried for api/agent service only
* add dispatch functions to handle the function name collisions between lib/neutron
  and lib/neutron-legacy

Usage of the new library is by setting the following in ENABLED_SERVICES

* neutron-api
* neutron-l3
* neutron-agent
* neutron-dhcp
* neutron-metadata-agent

For now, the new neutron library supports just the ML2 plugin. Ideally
different neutron plugins would become DevStack plugins. Work needs to
be done in this commit to make that possible, since there are lots of
configuration options that need to be set prior to the start of
neutron-api and other services.

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Depends-On: I166dc43372eef0243d53e3846dbc8e7a216317d2
Change-Id: I31b6362c6d9992f425f2dedbbeff2568390a93da

'}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2015-11-17 17:20:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/1a50da2671e00c9991135fa34c0d86236739a74c', 'message': 'Begin new lib/neutron

* minor tweaks to lib/template
* add new lib/neutron
* begin fleshing out the functions requried for api/agent service only
* add dispatch functions to handle the function name collisions between lib/neutron
  and lib/neutron-legacy

Usage of the new library is by setting the following in ENABLED_SERVICES

* neutron-api
* neutron-l3
* neutron-agent
* neutron-dhcp
* neutron-metadata-agent

For now, the new neutron library supports just the ML2 plugin. Ideally
different neutron plugins would become DevStack plugins. Work needs to
be done in this commit to make that possible, since there are lots of
configuration options that need to be set prior to the start of
neutron-api and other services.

Other significant changes from neutron-legacy:

* Remove knobs for isolated metadata and ovs_use_veth

* Rely on the Neutron defaults, and force Neutron to make
  sane defaults instead of all kinds of knobs in DevStack.

* Remove rootwrap daemon support for now. Maybe we should be more
  opinionated, and either use rootwrap daemon by default, or decide not
  to.

* Use the security group driver by default

* Delete calls to OVS cleanup Ideally these would be inside the OVS devstack plugin

* Remove call to neutron_plugin_create_nova_conf.
  The Linux Bridge plugin didn't actually do anything in this function,
  inside lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent

* Remove LINUXNET_VIF_DRIVER
  We remove it in Ibc270ce6ee622eee871df1f8c11f21e8be8280ee in
  neutron-legacy, so let's also go ahead and get rid of it here.

* Kill off vif_plugging inisets for now

* Hard code interface_driver to use Linux Bridge's interface driver

* Use Q_AGENT variable to determine which agent to run
  Works with Q_AGENT set to either "linuxbridge" or "openvswitch"

* Set ML2 configuration for VXLAN support

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Depends-On: I166dc43372eef0243d53e3846dbc8e7a216317d2
Change-Id: I31b6362c6d9992f425f2dedbbeff2568390a93da

configuration options that need to be set prior to the start of
neutron-api and other services.

Other significant changes from neutron-legacy:

* Remove knobs for isolated metadata and ovs_use_veth

* Rely on the Neutron defaults, and force Neutron to make
  sane defaults instead of all kinds of knobs in DevStack.

* Default to rootwrap daemon support

* Use the security group driver by default

* Delete calls to OVS cleanup. Ideally these would be inside the OVS devstack plugin

* Remove call to neutron_plugin_create_nova_conf.
  The Linux Bridge plugin didn't actually do anything in this function,
  inside lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent

* Remove LINUXNET_VIF_DRIVER
  We remove it in Ibc270ce6ee622eee871df1f8c11f21e8be8280ee in
  neutron-legacy, so let's also go ahead and get rid of it here.

* Kill off vif_plugging inisets for now

* interface_driver can now use Q_AGENT (linuxbridge, openvswitch), since
  they are entrypoints in neutron's setup.cfg

* Use Q_AGENT variable to determine which agent to run
  Works with Q_AGENT set to either "linuxbridge" or "openvswitch"
  Default is openvswitch for the time being.

* Set ML2 configuration for VXLAN support

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Change-Id: I31b6362c6d9992f425f2dedbbeff2568390a93da

'}, {'number': 47, 'created': '2016-05-03 13:10:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/14f8ee93028090c67a67ab1cf46385eb79823a01', 'message': 'Begin new lib/neutron

* minor tweaks to lib/template
* add new lib/neutron
* begin fleshing out the functions requried for api/agent service only
* add dispatch functions to handle the function name collisions between lib/neutron
  and lib/neutron-legacy

Usage of the new library is by setting the following in ENABLED_SERVICES

* neutron-api
* neutron-l3
* neutron-agent
* neutron-dhcp
* neutron-metadata-agent

For now, the new neutron library supports just the ML2 plugin. Ideally
different neutron plugins would become DevStack plugins. Work needs to
be done in this commit to make that possible, since there are lots of
configuration options that need to be set prior to the start of
neutron-api and other services.

Other significant changes from neutron-legacy:

* Remove knobs for isolated metadata and ovs_use_veth

* Rely on the Neutron defaults, and force Neutron to make
  sane defaults instead of all kinds of knobs in DevStack.

* Default to rootwrap daemon support

* Use the security group driver by default

* Delete calls to OVS cleanup. Ideally these would be inside the OVS devstack plugin

* Remove call to neutron_plugin_create_nova_conf.
  The Linux Bridge plugin didn't actually do anything in this function,
  inside lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent

* Remove LINUXNET_VIF_DRIVER
  We remove it in Ibc270ce6ee622eee871df1f8c11f21e8be8280ee in
  neutron-legacy, so let's also go ahead and get rid of it here.

* Kill off vif_plugging inisets for now

* interface_driver can now use Q_AGENT (linuxbridge, openvswitch), since
  they are entrypoints in neutron's setup.cfg

* Use Q_AGENT variable to determine which agent to run
  Works with Q_AGENT set to either "linuxbridge" or "openvswitch"
  Default is openvswitch for the time being.

* Set ML2 configuration for VXLAN support

* Remove Xen hypervisor stuff - it should be a plugin

* Clone neuron-lib

* Move L3 crud into separate service file
  There's a lot of L3 configuration that was in the main neutron file, but
  a lot of it is self contained and can be moved into its own file.

  The new l3 service file will contain all the previous L3 plumbing and
  configuration that the OpenStack Gate expects, while also eventually
  moving the whole l3 network creation step into a single hook that can be
  overridden by plugins.

Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Co-Authored-By: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I31b6362c6d9992f425f2dedbbeff2568390a93da

'}, {'number': 50, 'created': '2016-05-04 14:16:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/0a13c56fd87e70c7660e1ced7d6243a22c5784bc', 'message': 'Begin new lib/neutron

* minor tweaks to lib/template
* add new lib/neutron
* begin fleshing out the functions requried for api/agent service only
* add dispatch functions to handle the function name collisions between lib/neutron
  and lib/neutron-legacy

Usage of the new library is by setting the following in ENABLED_SERVICES

* neutron-api
* neutron-l3
* neutron-agent
* neutron-dhcp
* neutron-metadata-agent

For now, the new neutron library supports just the ML2 plugin. Ideally
different neutron plugins would become DevStack plugins. Work needs to
be done in this commit to make that possible, since there are lots of
configuration options that need to be set prior to the start of
neutron-api and other services.

Other significant changes from neutron-legacy:

* Remove knobs for isolated metadata and ovs_use_veth

* Rely on the Neutron defaults, and force Neutron to make
  sane defaults instead of all kinds of knobs in DevStack.

* Default to rootwrap daemon support

* Use the security group driver by default

* Delete calls to OVS cleanup. Ideally these would be inside the OVS devstack plugin

* Remove call to neutron_plugin_create_nova_conf.
  The Linux Bridge plugin didn't actually do anything in this function,
  inside lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent

* Remove LINUXNET_VIF_DRIVER
  We remove it in Ibc270ce6ee622eee871df1f8c11f21e8be8280ee in
  neutron-legacy, so let's also go ahead and get rid of it here.

* Kill off vif_plugging inisets for now

* interface_driver can now use Q_AGENT (linuxbridge, openvswitch), since
  they are entrypoints in neutron's setup.cfg

* Use Q_AGENT variable to determine which agent to run
  Works with Q_AGENT set to either "linuxbridge" or "openvswitch"
  Default is openvswitch for the time being.

* Set ML2 configuration for VXLAN support

* Remove Xen hypervisor stuff - it should be a plugin

* Clone neuron-lib

* Move L3 crud into separate service file
  There's a lot of L3 configuration that was in the main neutron file, but
  a lot of it is self contained and can be moved into its own file.

  The new l3 service file will contain all the previous L3 plumbing and
  configuration that the OpenStack Gate expects, while also eventually
  moving the whole l3 network creation step into a single hook that can be
  overridden by plugins.

Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Co-Authored-By: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I31b6362c6d9992f425f2dedbbeff2568390a93da

Background for this work can be read on the mailing list:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/094063.html

Usage of the new Neutron is by setting the following in
ENABLED_SERVICES:

* neutron-api
* neutron-l3
* neutron-agent
* neutron-dhcp
* neutron-metadata-agent

For now, the new neutron library supports just the ML2 plugin, with the
Open vSwitch and Linux Bridge agents supported. All other Neutron
plugins should be creating their own DevStack plugin if they wish for
DevStack to support them. Many of them already do.

The Open vSwitch agent is currently a little farther along in support,
there is a small bit of work that most likely needs to be done to configure
the Linux Bridge agent correctly.

Other notable changes compared to neutron-legacy:

* Rely on the Neutron defaults, and force Neutron to make
  sane defaults instead of all kinds of knobs in DevStack.

* Default to rootwrap daemon support

* interface_driver can now use NEUTRON_AGENT (linuxbridge, openvswitch), since
  they are entrypoints in neutron's setup.cfg

* Move L3 crud into separate service file:

  There's a lot of L3 configuration that was in the main neutron file, but
  a lot of it is self contained and can be moved into its own file.

  The new l3 service file will contain all the previous L3 plumbing and
  configuration that the OpenStack Gate expects, while also eventually
  moving the whole l3 network creation step into a single hook that can be
  overridden by plugins.

* Introduce a check for a function "neutron_plugin_create_initial_networks" which
  will become the mechanism through which different topologies, and
  networking plugins can create and wire the initial networks that are
  created during a stack.sh run.

The new lib/neutron is considered experimental, and followup patches will build upon this one. Existing
users of lib/neutron-legacy should remain unharmed.

Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>

commit_message:
Begin new lib/neutron

Background for this work can be read on the mailing list:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/094063.html

Usage of the new Neutron is by setting the following in
ENABLED_SERVICES:

* neutron-api
* neutron-l3
* neutron-agent
* neutron-dhcp
* neutron-metadata-agent

For now, the new neutron library supports just the ML2 plugin, with the
Open vSwitch and Linux Bridge agents supported. All other Neutron
plugins should be creating their own DevStack plugin if they wish for
DevStack to support them. Many of them already do.

Other notable changes compared to neutron-legacy:

* Rely on the Neutron defaults, and force Neutron to make
  sane defaults instead of all kinds of knobs in DevStack.

* Default to rootwrap daemon support

* Use the security group driver by default

* interface_driver can now use NEUTRON_AGENT (linuxbridge, openvswitch), since
  they are entrypoints in neutron's setup.cfg

* Use NEUTRON_AGENT variable to determine which agent to run
  Works with NEUTRON_AGENT set to either "linuxbridge" or "openvswitch"
  Default is openvswitch for the time being.

* Set ML2 configuration for VXLAN support

* Remove Xen hypervisor stuff - it should be a plugin

* Move L3 crud into separate service file:

  There's a lot of L3 configuration that was in the main neutron file, but
  a lot of it is self contained and can be moved into its own file.

  The new l3 service file will contain all the previous L3 plumbing and
  configuration that the OpenStack Gate expects, while also eventually
  moving the whole l3 network creation step into a single hook that can be
  overridden by plugins.

* Introduce a check for a function "neutron_plugin_create_initial_networks" which
  will become the mechanism through which different topologies, and
  networking plugins can create and wire the initial networks that are
  created during a stack.sh run.

The new lib/neutron is considered experimental, and followup patches
will build upon this one. Existing users of lib/neutron-legacy should
remain unharmed.

Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Co-Authored-By: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I31b6362c6d9992f425f2dedbbeff2568390a93da

If a driver implements optimized migration, share status is stuck
'migrating' and task state is stuck 'migration_in_progress' if
2-phase migration is not used. This change addresses it by properly
setting the task state and status for this specific scenario.
This change also adds 'host' to model update performed by manager,
to prevent confusion related to drivers having to return such

Closes-bug: #1563823
(cherry picked from commit 143decf4bc3d1e4f686a7dc7e5336791edc487a3)

Change-Id: I3f526817a4b352dd58956666cc2f59180e495623

commit_message:
Fix Share status when driver migrates

If a driver implements optimized migration, share status is stuck
'migrating' and task state is stuck 'migration_in_progress' if
2-phase migration is not used. This change addresses it by properly
setting the task state and status for this specific scenario.
This change also adds 'host' to model update performed by manager,
to prevent confusion related to drivers having to return such
value in their model update or not.

Closes-bug: #1563823
(cherry picked from commit 143decf4bc3d1e4f686a7dc7e5336791edc487a3)

Change-Id: I3f526817a4b352dd58956666cc2f59180e495623
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/28/313528/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

{'host': 'fake_host'} driver_migration_info = 'driver_fake_info' # mocks self.mock_object(self.share_manager.db, 'share_get', mock.Mock(return_value=share)) self.mock_object(self.share_manager.db, 'share_update') self.mock_object(self.share_manager.db, 'share_instance_update') self.mock_object(rpcapi.ShareAPI, 'migration_get_driver_info', mock.Mock(return_value=driver_migration_info)) self.mock_object(self.share_manager.driver, 'migration_start', mock.Mock(return_value=return_value)) if not return_value[0]: self.mock_object(self.share_manager, '_migration_start_generic') # run Enable ha router support in Horizon

This patch creates a variable to control ha router support in Horizon
and enables it by default.

Release notes are included.

Change-Id: I5edb7576d977bc558d9411dca62a029eb1856000
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add Gentoo to distro status

Gentoo packages OpenStack and as such should (optionally) have packages
looked up when adding packages to requirements.

I've added Gentoo as a distro between Debian and SUSE for alphabetical
reasons only and have also added a link to our official package tracker.

Change-Id: Id4bd773510422a793854d46e7dcaa4e69ed36625
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/90/311490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: on these platforms (and ideally Debian and SUSE as well).

commit_message:
Give helpful error in tests if strace is missing

The functional reload test depends on the strace executable. If it is
not found then a very unclear backtrace is given and the test fails.

Change-Id: I736a7f554953916036b2e002fd88917e01388e42

commit_message:
Fix serial console worker blocking Nova

The worker used by Nova to log instance serial console output can
log an exception message.

The issue is that logging a message from a different thread causes
Nova to hang. It seems that the logging file handler causes issues
when greenthreads and multiple native threads are used at the same,
and the native threads log messages.

This patch removes this log message for now. In the future, we
should fix the logging handler to avoid this issue.

NOTE: This issue has already been solved in Mitaka in os-win,
which the Hyper-V driver uses since Mitaka.

(cherry picked from commit a25959a204f365a532138d7fe0a73b4cd039e807)

Change-Id: Ia5c1aba28347648e90f5ba6111fc047d711236db
Closes-Bug: #1557498
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/314590/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception:
deleted_lines: import errnofrom nova.i18n import _LE except IOError as err: # Invalid argument error means that the vm console pipe was closed, # probably the vm was stopped. The worker can stop it's execution. if err.errno != errno.EINVAL: LOG.error(_LE("Error writing vm console log file from " "serial console pipe. Error: %s") % err)

commit_message:
Cleanup orphaned code from image and manager

There were several methods in the image module and manager code that
were no longer being used anywhere. While some of these have
potential for being useful, they are not in use and should not be
sitting around the codebase waiting for someone to need them.

Change-Id: Id3f3320c4153dabad309699698b0e52f8312c081

commit_message:
Update keystone service name for signing keys

Since keystone is being run under apache, the signing keys should notify
apache and not the keystone service.  The keystone service is actually
disabled, so if the keys get updated nothing happens.

Change-Id: Idfebeabf03d010956569c32b24437245e2b93c2a
Related-Bug: #1581591

commit_message:
Add documentation guidance to the contributor guide

The patch adds some guiding content regarding documentation and also
fixes the headings to comply with the OpenStack Documentation Style
Guide.

Change-Id: Ie5d3d703e27f3f572138c451d760cf6fb398928d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/61/316061/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: release note generated using `the reno tool`_. Please see the `Documentation and Release Note Guidelines`_ for more information.Documentation and Release Note Guidelines ----------------------------------------- Documentation is a critical part of ensuring that the consumers of OpenStack-Ansible are appropriately informed about: * How to use the project's tooling effectively to deploy OpenStack; * How to implement the right configuration to meet the needs of their specific use-case; * To understand the changes in the project over time which may affect an existing deployment. To meet these needs developers must employ the use of documentation and release notes which should be submitted along with any code submissions. All forms of documentation should comply with the guidelines provided in the `OpenStack Documentation Contributor Guide`_, with particular reference to the following sections: * Writing style * RST formatting conventions Release notes are generated using `the reno tool`_. Release notes must be written with the following guidelines in mind: * Each list item must make sense to read without the context of the patch or the repository the patch is being submitted into. The reason for this is that all release notes are consolidated and presented in a long list without reference to the source patch or the context of the repository. * Each note should be brief and to the point. Try to avoid multi-paragraph notes. For features the note should typically refer to documentation for more details. For bug fixes the note can refer to a registered bug for more details. In most cases only the following sections should be used for new release notes submitted with patches: * ``features``: This should inform the deployer briefly about a new feature and should describe how to use it either by referencing the variables to set or by referring to documentation. * ``issues``: This should inform the deployer about known issues. This may be used when fixing an issue and wanting to inform deployers about a workaround that can be used for versions prior to that which contains the patch that fixes the issue. Issue notes should specifically make mention of what versions of OpenStack-Ansible are affected by the issue. * ``upgrade``: This should inform the deployer about changes which may affect them when upgrading from a previous major or minor version. Typically these notes would describe changes to default variable values or variables that have been removed. * ``deprecations``: If a variable has been deprecated (ideally using the deprecation filter) then it should be communicated through notes in this section. Note that if a variable has been removed entirely then it has not been deprecated and the removal should be noted in the ``upgrade`` section. .. _OpenStack Documentation Contributor Guide: http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/
deleted_lines: release note generated using `the reno tool`_.

subject: Removed smoke tags from all -api job tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-18 21:08:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/456ed9d7264cb31370e127bdbb58ed7540fa05f3', 'message': "Removed smoke tags from all -api job tests

The tag is supposed to mark just tests that are at the core of the
functionality. The -api job though is supposed to validate features that
are not core to cloud operation (those tests for core features go into
tempest tree).

Some CI systems (like the one of Puppet sub-project) rely on the tag to
filter out just must-run tests. Neutron injecting all those tests into
their CI by the merit of a tempest plugin makes their jobs crash on
timeout.

So let's just kill all smoke tags from existing tests.

Change-Id: Id0bbfef2058363c22dc042c8d0793a1df7bac3aa
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-19 02:20:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6cc842e60f5f2a8552fbb931ec15bf9190c5d4ae', 'message': 'Removed smoke tags from all -api job tests

can be run via a Tempest plugin, therefore there is a chance that these
are picked up unwillingly by some CI systems (like the one of Puppet

commit_message:
Removed smoke tags from all -api job tests

Most of the smoke tests now in the Neutron tree were inherited from Tempest
and are in the process of being reconciled back. Since [1], Neutron tests
can be run via a Tempest plugin, therefore there is a chance that these
are picked up unwillingly by some CI systems (like the one of Puppet
sub-project).

We should purge the tags for now, complete the de-fork and consider which
ones are worth the tag again.

[1] Ia233aa162746845f6ae08a8157dcd242dcd58eab
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-tempest-defork-patches-since-initial-sync

Change-Id: Id0bbfef2058363c22dc042c8d0793a1df7bac3aa

commit_message:
Revert "stop managing eventlet service on RedHat"

I believe this has broken TripleO. CI jobs are failing with:
Error: Could not find dependent Service[keystone] for
File[/etc/keystone/ssl/certs/signing_cert.pem] at
/etc/puppet/modules/tripleo/manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp:101

Partial-Bug: 1581591
This reverts commit cb1ed62563af554302cd0fdcde39a1f88c4b3c8f.

Change-Id: I757e4b419ca3b14132a3fbc337622f1ee36e90e3

subject: Enable python34 tests for nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt.test_config*
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-02 17:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests-py3.txt', 'nova/tests/unit/matchers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/83a789366dc85ae5722ed67617d8853a9e36f9d4', 'message': 'Enable python34 tests for nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt.test_config*

With python34, some of the unit tests were passing bytes instead of strings
to XMLMatches which was causing six.StringIO() to report failure:
TypeError: initial_value must be str or None, not bytes

The fix is to convert the bytes to a proper string.

Note: Python27 evaluates isinstance(str, bytes) to True even for a string.  For
this reason we first exclude strings in the condition and then evaluate if it
is bytes.

Change-Id: Ic2252132b0a8b9f4fc35b00186c533b942de789f
PartiallyImplements: blueprint nova-python3-newton
'}]
commit_message:
Enable python34 tests for nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt.test_config*

With python34, some of the unit tests were passing bytes instead of strings
to XMLMatches which was causing six.StringIO() to report failure:
TypeError: initial_value must be str or None, not bytes

The fix is to convert the bytes to a proper string.

Note: Python27 evaluates isinstance(str, bytes) to True even for a string.  For
this reason we first exclude strings in the condition and then evaluate if it
is bytes.

Change-Id: Ic2252132b0a8b9f4fc35b00186c533b942de789f
PartiallyImplements: blueprint nova-python3-newton
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/311794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (not isinstance(expected, six.string_types) and isinstance(expected, six.binary_type)): expected = expected.decode('utf-8') if (not isinstance(actual_xml, six.string_types) and isinstance(actual_xml, six.binary_type)): actual_xml = actual_xml.decode('utf-8')

commit_message:
Stop configuring neutron to enforce DHCP MTU option

Since Mitaka, Neutron does the right job to calculate and advertise
correct MTU to instances, out of the box.

Change-Id: I119cf3c2bf5fc7b6f7f049381b85a6b1c3aa8779
(cherry picked from commit 273cef616db46abacc87be58692b1629ee744426)

commit_message:
Add a 'resources pre_create phase'

Add a 'resources pre_create phase' so that we can create the neutron
network earlier in the process and then allow Ironic to also have a
pre_create step to use the network and perform actions on it before it
is used by nova in the 'create phase'

For projects/50_neutron/resources.sh move what was in the 'create'
step to the 'pre_create' step.

Change-Id: I046e25a698be154ae22208bb50690ec5a615c611
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/20/316220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Correct some misspelt words in glance

There are some misspelt words in glance,
    specfied (specified)
    pluging (plugin)
    cient (client)
    siganture (signature)
    propertys (properties)
    delted (deleted)
    collumn (column)
    pacakge (package)
    sigle (single)
    logile (logfile)

commit_message:
Deprecate keystone.common.kvs

Since only the memcache backends (that are being removed) use the
kvs system in keystone now, this can be safely deprecated.

Change-Id: I395e66bc957465df0f38ccfc3c48900e1b3a3320

commit_message:
Clarify language used in glanceapi future section

As per the comments and agreement on
Iede37e61784b6a8a974ce0ae29ccfab510d8cc53 , this patch proposes the
concerned changes. The former patch was merged as the consensus on the
idea of the Images API future section was converged. This is merely a
simplification to the grammatical tone on the respective sections.

Change-Id: Iefbdeadb78b2a7b866495d4a8f3e7a84cee46fe2

Thus, although conceptuallyOpenStack services. Its current status as of the Liberty release is SUPPORTED. The Images v1 API is closed to further development, and the Glance code implementing the v1 API accepts only serious bugfixes.

commit_message:
Change keystone admin/internal insecure flags

Make `keystone_service_internaluri_insecure` and
`keystone_service_adminuri_insecure` flag default values
derived from facts like protocol each endpoint is using and
kind of certificates being used to reach that endpoint
(user-provided or self-signed).

Combined backport of:
 - 2ffb77638f48d75a444c35e619355cd6f1339076
 - 8387b680f7724b80ff9cf4b4577e6a7afbd15322

Change-Id: I921031c676776884cb121a7914fcd9c505345e67
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Closes-Bug: 1566629

commit_message:
Tag the alembic migration revisions for Mitaka

Previously when we had one repo with one alembic branch we would
create a milestone revision on that single branch. Now we have
multiple repos and expand/contract branches for each repo.
So from now on we tag the final revision on every branch when we make
a milestone release.

Since no new migration scripts were added during the Mitaka cycle
in networking-l2gw, this patch adds the tag in Liberty expand
and contract scripts.

Change-Id: I720f1089dc725f8e3856725a6a4334115a44cd24
Closes-Bug: #1581158

commit_message:
Put back missing sysmeta unit tests

We lost some unit tests from test_sysmeta.py in [1].
This patch restores them. Since the proxy no longer
implements post-as-copy or COPY then we need to plumb
in a copy middleware to the test app in test_sysmeta.

It is a little odd perhaps to have these tests under
test/unit/proxy but the alternative is to duplicate
the test setup and base test code that already exists
in test_sysmeta.py into test_copy.py.

[1] commit 46d61a4dcd9a5d9157625c06d6fe7d916e80c3d2
    (server side copy middleware)

Change-Id: Iec02387ccbddbe3841a417880389c707cd5c0346
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/13/315613/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

check sysmeta is updated by a COPY in same way as user meta by # issuing requests to the copy middleware app path = '/v1/a/c/o' dest = '/c/o2' env = {'REQUEST_METHOD': 'PUT'} hdrs = dict(self.original_sysmeta_headers_1) hdrs.update(self.original_sysmeta_headers_2) hdrs.update(self.original_meta_headers_1) hdrs.update(self.original_meta_headers_2) req = Request.blank(path, environ=env, headers=hdrs, body='x') resp = req.get_response(self.copy_app) self._assertStatus(resp, 201) env = {'REQUEST_METHOD': 'COPY'} hdrs = dict(self.changed_sysmeta_headers) hdrs.update(self.new_sysmeta_headers) hdrs.update(self.changed_meta_headers) hdrs.update(self.new_meta_headers) hdrs.update(self.bad_headers) hdrs.update({'Destination': dest}) req = Request.blank(path, environ=env, headers=hdrs) resp = req.get_response(self.copy_app) self._assertStatus(resp, 201) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.changed_sysmeta_headers) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.new_sysmeta_headers) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.original_sysmeta_headers_2) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.changed_meta_headers) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.new_meta_headers) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.original_meta_headers_2) self._assertNotInHeaders(resp, self.bad_headers) req = Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o2', environ={}) resp = req.get_response(self.copy_app) self._assertStatus(resp, 200) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.changed_sysmeta_headers) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.new_sysmeta_headers) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.original_sysmeta_headers_2) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.changed_meta_headers) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.new_meta_headers) self._assertInHeaders(resp, self.original_meta_headers_2) self._assertNotInHeaders(resp, self.bad_headers) def test_sysmeta_updated_by_COPY_from(self): # quickstart.rst now covers how to generate cert and sign certs for
authenticating with Kubernetes using the native Kubernetes API for
launching the redis example.

Change-Id: I5cb6459963f34812f2067e2c0952d06079080782
'}]
commit_message:
Update documentation to use native APIs

The documentation needs updating after removing the Magnum APIs for
creating containers, rcs, services and pods. The documentation in
quickstart.rst now covers how to generate cert and sign certs for
authenticating with Kubernetes using the native Kubernetes API for
launching the redis example.

Change-Id: I5cb6459963f34812f2067e2c0952d06079080782
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/79/311879/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo cp -a kubernetes/platforms/linux/amd64/kubectl /usr/bin/kubectl We first need to setup the certs to allow Kubernetes to authenticate our connection. See tls.rst for more info on using TLS keys/certs which are setup below. To generate an RSA key, you will use the 'genrsa' command of the 'openssl' tool.:: openssl genrsa -out client.key 4096 To generate a CSR for client authentication, openssl requires a config file that specifies a few values.:: $ cat > client.conf << END [req] distinguished_name = req_distinguished_name req_extensions = req_ext prompt = no [req_distinguished_name] CN = Your Name [req_ext] extendedKeyUsage = clientAuth END Once you have client.conf, you can run the openssl 'req' command to generate the CSR.:: openssl req -new -days 365 \ -config client.conf \ -key client.key \ -out client.csr Now that you have your client CSR, you can use the Magnum CLI to send it off to Magnum to get it signed and also download the signing cert.:: magnum ca-sign secure-k8sbay client.csr > client.crt magnum ca-show secure-k8sbay > ca.crt Here's how to set up the replicated redis example. Now we create a pod for the redis-master:: KUBERNETES_URL=$(magnum bay-show k8sbay | awk '/ api_address /{print $4}') # Set kubectl to use the correct certs kubectl config set-cluster k8sbay --server=${KUBERNETES_URL} \ --certificate-authority=ca.crt kubectl config set-credentials client --certificate-authority=ca.crt \ --client-key=${PWD}/client.key --client-certificate=client.crt kubectl config set-context k8sbay --cluster=secure-k8sbay --user=client kubectl config use-context k8sbay # Test the cert and connection works kubectl version kubectl create -f ./redis-master.yaml kubectl create -f ./redis-sentinel-service.yaml --server TODO kubectl create -f ./redis-controller.yaml --server TODO kubectl create -f ./redis-sentinel-controller.yaml --server TODOFor example, magnum bay-create, magnum baymodel-delete. TODO set docker up docker run --name test-container \ --image docker.io/cirros:latest \ --bay swarmbay \ --command "ping -c 4 8.8.8.8" docker container-logs test-container TODO fix
deleted_lines: **NOTE:** We do not need to install Kubernetes, we just need the example file from the tarball. Here's how to set up the replicated redis example. First, create a pod for the redis-master:: magnum pod-create --manifest ./redis-master.yaml --bay k8sbay magnum coe-service-create --manifest ./redis-sentinel-service.yaml --bay k8sbay magnum rc-create --manifest ./redis-controller.yaml --bay k8sbay magnum rc-create --manifest ./redis-sentinel-controller.yaml --bay k8sbayFor example, magnum bay-create, magnum baymodel-delete, magnum rc-show, magnum coe-service-list. magnum container-create --name test-container \ --image docker.io/cirros:latest \ --bay swarmbay \ --command "ping -c 4 8.8.8.8" +------------+----------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +------------+----------------------------------------+ | uuid | 25485358-ae9b-49d1-a1e1-1af0a7c3f911 | | links | ... | | bay_uuid | eda91c1e-6103-45d4-ab09-3f316310fa8e | | updated_at | None | | image | cirros | | command | ping -c 4 8.8.8.8 | | created_at | 2015-04-22T20:21:11+00:00 | | name | test-container | +------------+----------------------------------------+ magnum container-start test-container magnum container-logs test-container

commit_message:
Enable TLS support for k8s CoreOS

* Add cloud-init to generate TLS certificates in each node.
* Modify coreos fragments to point to the path of certificates.
* Add support for "--tls-disabled" to turn off TLS.
* Use Keystone trust to retrieve TLS certificates.

Implements: blueprint tls-for-coreos-bay
Change-Id: I66842f9374abe5a9bbf275fa130c0eae3e6065ab

added_lines: default: 6443 user_token: type: string description: token used for communicating back to Magnum for TLS certs bay_uuid: type: string description: identifier for the bay this template is generating magnum_url: type: string description: endpoint to retrieve TLS certs from "$BAY_UUID": {get_param: bay_uuid} "$USER_TOKEN": {get_param: user_token} "$MAGNUM_URL": {get_param: magnum_url} make_cert: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: ungrouped config: {get_file: fragments/make-cert-coreos.yaml} $make_cert - name: "make-cert.service" command: "start" "$make_cert": {get_attr: [make_cert, config]}
deleted_lines: dns_nameserver: type: string description: address of a dns nameserver reachable in your environment default: 8.8.8.8 default: 8080

commit_message:
Added apache component
Add test and mods for deployment as an apache module

Change-Id: I6f693c0aa41af7190b4466910795a07546347ce5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/62/263462/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper_acceptance' describe 'barbican::api class' do context 'default parameters' do pp= <<-EOS include ::openstack_integration include ::openstack_integration::repos include ::openstack_integration::mysql include ::openstack_integration::keystone # Barbican resources include ::barbican class { '::barbican::keystone::auth': password => 'a_big_secret', } class { '::barbican::api': verbose => true, auth_type => 'keystone', keystone_password => 'a_big_secret', service_name => 'httpd', } include ::apache class { '::barbican::wsgi::apache': ssl => false, } EOS it 'should work with no errors' do # Run it twice and test for idempotency apply_manifest(pp, :catch_failures => true) apply_manifest(pp, :catch_changes => true) end describe 'store a secret' do it 'should store a secret' do shell('barbican --os-username barbican --os-password a_big_secret --os-tenant-name services --os-auth-url http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 --endpoint http://localhost:9311 secret store --payload "my big bad secret" --os-identity-api-version 2') do |r| expect(r.stdout).to match(/ACTIVE/) end end end describe 'generate a secret' do it 'should generate a secret' do shell('barbican --os-username barbican --os-password a_big_secret --os-tenant-name services --os-auth-url http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 --endpoint http://localhost:9311 order create --name foo --type key --os-identity-api-version 2') do |r| expect(r.stdout).to match(/Order href/) end end end describe port(9311) do it { is_expected.to be_listening.with('tcp') } end end end

subject: WIP: Enforce clarity by using keyword-only arguments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-01 17:53:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.context/commit/db86e8feac4e6e75cf7cb3da3fd385da6c6efe5c', 'message': "Enforce clarity by using keyword-only arguments

For the call to create a RequestContext object, ensure that the caller
is using keyword arguments. The benefit of this is that there is no
confusion about what arguments are being used.

Previously callers could make a call like:
  ctx = RequestContext(None, 'user', None, 'example.com')

This change will require the callers to specify each argument using a
keyword.

Added unit tests for change.

Change-Id: I70a351e1025c21663c155423e517bd384cca6d02
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-04 17:02:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.context/commit/4634f88cb2886d326555294a4f9d48ede0f51f78', 'message': "WIP: Enforce clarity by using keyword-only arguments

Start the initial work to ensure that callers creating a RequestContext
object will do so with keyword arguments. The benefit of this is that
there is no confusion about what arguments are being used.

Previously callers could make a call like:
  ctx = RequestContext(None, 'user', None, 'example.com')

This change is the first step in requiring the callers to specify each
argument using a keyword.

Added unit tests for change.

TODO: Figure out how to do logging to warn developers to fix their code
to use keyword arguments if they are using plain args.

Change-Id: I70a351e1025c21663c155423e517bd384cca6d02

commit_message:
WIP: Enforce clarity by using keyword-only arguments

Start the initial work to ensure that callers creating a RequestContext
object will do so with keyword arguments. The benefit of this is that
there is no confusion about what arguments are being used.

Previously callers could make a call like:
  ctx = RequestContext(None, 'user', None, 'example.com')

This change is the first step in requiring the callers to specify each
argument using a keyword.

Added unit tests for change.

TODO: Figure out how to do logging to warn developers to fix their code
to use keyword arguments if they are using plain args.

Change-Id: I70a351e1025c21663c155423e517bd384cca6d02

commit_message:
Add console.html summary and viewer

This adds a new console.html summary and details view that can
gives overview information about console output, organizes output
by section, and can also determine the currently running script at
job failure time. The console viewer is a CodeMirror-based widget
that provides basic highlighting and folding capabilities to make
console output easier to browse.

Change-Id: I27a9a532ae117d2914dc2f3a866c780378e79f72

commit_message:
remove verbose option in devstack plugin

This option is deprecated in Mitaka and has been removed in Newton,
and its default value is True already. Let's remove it.
ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314573/

Change-Id: Id1bb4d4a7068d80e3df6f95b83315cf6511dd6ea

commit_message:
add team pages

Add pages to show the work each team has produced. For now, only
official teams using cycle-based release models are included. In a later
phase we will add deliverables that are currently listed as indepdent.

Change-Id: Ieb54aa7a4d2f58f462692e295c8f19978d5baa73
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Replace manually changing CONF options

Changing config parameters by one test can lead to wrong behavior
other tests in race conditions. Use a mechanism for overwriting
config options (self.flags and self.override_config methods of TestCase).

Change-Id: I97c58c08104e4da6f3f0386d9396224e71461856

commit_message:
3PAR: Remove metadata that tracks the instance id

HPE added some additional tracking of the instanced ID metadata on the
3PAR storage arrays back in Icehouse. When a volume was attached, the
instance ID was stored on the 3PAR and removed on detach.
Initially this this was over SSH and moved to REST calls due to
performance issues. Many customers still have issues with this unused
feature on upgrades and under heavy load.

The tracking of the instance ID is no longer required by HPE and has no
affect on any of the Cinder functionality. This unused feature will also
be a problem when multi-attach lands, so it's being removed by this
patch.

Change-Id: Ic181e6598f37a727b41c093e0c09abe229183d6f
Closes-Bug: #1572665

If key already exists, the value will be replaced. """ LOG.debug("VOLUME (%(disp_name)s : %(vol_name)s %(id)s) " "Updating KEY-VALUE pair: (%(key)s : %(val)s)", {'disp_name': volume['display_name'], 'vol_name': volume['name'], 'id': self._get_3par_vol_name(volume['id']), 'key': key, 'val': value}) try: volume_name = self._get_3par_vol_name(volume['id']) if value is None: value = '' self.client.setVolumeMetaData(volume_name, key, value) except Exception as ex: msg = _('Failure in update_volume_key_value_pair:%s') % ex LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) def clear_volume_key_value_pair(self, volume, key): """Clears key,value pairs metadata from virtual volume.""" LOG.debug("VOLUME (%(disp_name)s : %(vol_name)s %(id)s) " "Clearing Key : %(key)s)", {'disp_name': volume['display_name'], 'vol_name': volume['name'], 'id': self._get_3par_vol_name(volume['id']), 'key': key}) try: volume_name = self._get_3par_vol_name(volume['id']) self.client.removeVolumeMetaData(volume_name, key) except Exception as ex: LOG.warning(_LW('Issue occurred in clear_volume_key_value_pair: ' '%s'), six.text_type(ex)) def attach_volume(self, volume, instance_uuid): """Save the instance UUID in the volume. TODO: add support for multi-attach """ LOG.debug("Attach Volume\n%s", pprint.pformat(volume)) try: self.update_volume_key_value_pair(volume, 'HPQ-CS-instance_uuid', instance_uuid) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Error attaching volume %s"), volume) def detach_volume(self, volume, attachment=None): """Remove the instance uuid from the volume. TODO: add support for multi-attach. """ LOG.debug("Detach Volume\n%s", pprint.pformat(volume)) try: self.clear_volume_key_value_pair(volume, 'HPQ-CS-instance_uuid') except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Error detaching volume %s"), volume)

how to generate test data. Comments/additions welcome.

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright (c) 2016 Hewlett-Packard Enterprise Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import json import os from oslo_config import cfg import oslo_messaging import sys import time try: import urlparse as urlparse except ImportError: import urllib.parse as urlparse topic = 'searchlight_indexer' password = os.environ.get('OS_PASSWORD') host = urlparse.urlparse(os.environ.get('OS_AUTH_URL')).hostname username = 'stackrabbit' class EP(object): def info(self, ctxt, publisher_id, event_type, payload, metadata): all_locals = locals() all_locals.pop('self') print(json.dumps(all_locals)) def error(self, ctxt, publisher_id, event_type, payload, metadata): all_locals = locals() all_locals.pop('self') print(json.dumps(all_locals)) def main(): if len(sys.argv) < 2: print("Supply an exchange") sys.exit(0) exchange = sys.argv[1] pool = sys.argv[2] if len(sys.argv) > 2 else None transport = oslo_messaging.get_transport( cfg.CONF, url='rabbit://%s:%s@%s' % (username, password, host)) targets = [oslo_messaging.Target(topic=topic, exchange=exchange)] endpoints = [EP()] oslo_listener = oslo_messaging.get_notification_listener( transport, targets, endpoints, pool=pool, executor='threading') try: print("Started") oslo_listener.start() while True: time.sleep(1) except KeyboardInterrupt: print("Stopping") oslo_listener.stop() oslo_listener.wait() if __name__ == '__main__': main()

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mongodb # # Mongodb Pacemaker HA profile for tripleo # # === Parameters # # [*mongodb_node_ips*] # List of The mongodb node ip addresses # # [*mongodb_replset*] # Mongodb replicaset name # # [*mongodb_ipv6_enabled*] # A boolean value for mongodb server ipv6 is enabled or not # Defaults to false # # [*bootstrap_node*] # (Optional) The hostname of the node responsible for bootstrapping tasks # Defaults to hiera('bootstrap_nodeid') # # [*step*] # (Optional) The current step in deployment. See tripleo-heat-templates # for more details. # Defaults to hiera('step') # # [*enable_load_balancer*] # (Optional) Whether load balancing is enabled for this cluster # Defaults to hiera('enable_load_balancer', true) # class tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mongodb ( $mongodb_node_ips, $mongodb_replset, $mongodb_ipv6_enabled = false, $bootstrap_node = hiera('bootstrap_nodeid'), $step = hiera('step'), $enable_load_balancer = hiera('enable_load_balancer', true), ) { if $::hostname == downcase($bootstrap_node) { $pacemaker_master = true } else { $pacemaker_master = false } if $step >= 1 { include ::mongodb::globals include ::mongodb::client class { '::mongodb::server' : service_manage => false, } } if $step >= 2 { # NOTE(gfidente): the following vars are needed on all nodes so they # need to stay out of pacemaker_master conditional. # The addresses mangling will hopefully go away when we'll be able to # configure the connection string via hostnames, until then, we need to pass # the list of IPv6 addresses *with* port and without the brackets as 'members' # argument for the 'mongodb_replset' resource. if str2bool($mongodb_ipv6_enabled) { $mongo_node_ips_with_port_prefixed = prefix($mongodb_node_ips, '[') $mongo_node_ips_with_port = suffix($mongo_node_ips_with_port_prefixed, ']:27017') $mongo_node_ips_with_port_nobr = suffix($mongodb_node_ips, ':27017') } else { $mongo_node_ips_with_port = suffix($mongodb_node_ips, ':27017') $mongo_node_ips_with_port_nobr = suffix($mongodb_node_ips, ':27017') } $mongo_node_string = join($mongo_node_ips_with_port, ',') } if $step >= 2 and $pacemaker_master and $enable_load_balancer { pacemaker::resource::service { $::mongodb::params::service_name : op_params => 'start timeout=370s stop timeout=200s', clone_params => true, require => Class['::mongodb::server'], } # NOTE (spredzy) : The replset can only be run # once all the nodes have joined the cluster. mongodb_conn_validator { $mongo_node_ips_with_port : timeout => '600', require => Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$::mongodb::params::service_name], before => Mongodb_replset[$mongodb_replset], } mongodb_replset { $mongodb_replset : members => $mongo_node_ips_with_port_nobr, } } }

commit_message:
[network] Updates to "Using SR-IOV functionality"

- Indicate how a user can discover how many VFs a given PF can support.
- PF interface need to be 'up' else spawn will fail.


Change-Id: I840f24f57fef5a1d42cc5cbc1f708e5f13f35cb8
(cherry picked from commit d291408ba2e0bcdb013709bcb6f267c05b5f50c1)
(cherry picked from commit 096e4e5c8b3b72b84a5a536f9ba461b9fa7d4cb2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/64/314964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: make sure it is enabled. After enabling VT-d, enable IOMMU on .. note:: On some PCI devices, observe that when changing the amount of VFs you receive the error ``Device or resource busy``. In this case, you first need to set ``sriov_numvfs`` to ``0``, then set it to your new value. .. warning:: Alternatively, you can create VFs by passing the ``max_vfs`` to the kernel module of your network interface. However, the ``max_vfs`` parameter has been deprecated, so the PCI SYS interface is the preferred method. You can determine the maximum number of VFs a PF can support: .. code-block:: console # cat /sys/class/net/eth3/device/sriov_totalvfs 63 If the interface is down, make sure it is set to ``up`` before launching a guest, else the instance will fail to spawn: .. code-block:: console # ip link set eth3 up # ip link show eth3 8: eth3: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP mode DEFAULT qlen 1000 link/ether a0:36:9f:8f:3f:b8 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff vf 0 MAC 00:00:00:00:00:00, spoof checking on, link-state auto vf 1 MAC 00:00:00:00:00:00, spoof checking on, link-state auto vf 2 MAC 00:00:00:00:00:00, spoof checking on, link-state auto vf 3 MAC 00:00:00:00:00:00, spoof checking on, link-state auto vf 4 MAC 00:00:00:00:00:00, spoof checking on, link-state auto vf 5 MAC 00:00:00:00:00:00, spoof checking on, link-state auto vf 6 MAC 00:00:00:00:00:00, spoof checking on, link-state auto vf 7 MAC 00:00:00:00:00:00, spoof checking on, link-state auto

commit_message:
Add install-bin element

The various distro elements include a copy of this script which installs
all files in the bin/ dir of the copied element hooks in to
/usr/local/bin. Lets share code rather than repeating ourselves.

Change-Id: I354382f8c42ede2e9b8c548b7df8367c03e6836e

commit_message:
User and database tests wait for casted actions

User and database actions like create, delete and update
are guestagent casts. The tests cannot reliably assume
they would be completed once the client call returns
(especially on datastores other than MySQL).

Add methods to wait for listing changes after the above actions.

Change-Id: Ic84b028e67ce19fb9297ebcacd2aafa6fd058d43

commit_message:
Add test dependency installation on Gentoo

Here I add test deps for Gentoo, the main ones to call out are as follows.

* pyyaml: not installed by default and needed for the package element
* parted: not installed by default and needed for the VM element
* multipath-tools: not installed by default and provides kpartx

Change-Id: I07ce871fb3e684bfd9d06268d5c5bd118314f321

commit_message:
Ironic's agent_ssh job is deployed with IPA

Without this set, agent_ssh job will not properly setup devstack for
itself explicitly, today it's only passing because the missing configs
are filled in with devstack defaults.

Change-Id: I7902346c2f177c453d8d39f080132cd2da48470c

commit_message:
Extract manifests and astute.yaml sync to be ASAP

This fix ensures that any plugins can run even if
their tasks depend on pre-deployment stage. This fix
puts plugins/manifests rsync and astute.yaml upload
even earlier than pre-deployment stage. Otherwise it
would put burden on plugin developers to update old versions
of their plugins to do things after pre-deployment-end
which makes no sense.

Change-Id: I6c36ac4aef027ef4560b20f9f5a697ddb361b9e3
Partial-bug: #1572276

commit_message:
stop managing eventlet service on RedHat

RedHat packaging dropped the eventlet service (openstack-keystone) so we
no longer need to manage it (we used to stop the service before starting
httpd to make sure apache can start without binding issue).

So we still maintain the service stop for Debian & Ubuntu, since they
sitll provide the scripts.
Once they'll drop it, we'll drop the Service resource and deprecate
keystone::service class that will be useless.

Change-Id: Iecef6f2829ef4bf9162e77ef024d53eedf485726
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/70/315770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if $::osfamily == 'Debian' { class { '::keystone::service': ensure => 'stopped', service_name => $::keystone::params::service_name, enable => false, validate => false, } # leave this here because Ubuntu packages will start Keystone and we need it stopped # before apache can run Service['keystone'] -> Service[$service_name_real] }
deleted_lines: class { '::keystone::service': ensure => 'stopped', service_name => $::keystone::params::service_name, enable => false, validate => false, } # leave this here because Ubuntu packages will start Keystone and we need it stopped # before apache can run Service['keystone'] -> Service[$service_name_real]

commit_message:
Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

his commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend which enables
the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the Newton oslo.messaging release is
an update to the AMQP 1.0 driver to support a stateless messaging interconnect
for RPC traffic[1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I314f0f6bbba07d32f720b650b12c7bd30d07d295
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/26/315026/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove XStatic-JQuery.Bootstrap.Wizard

This package was added when Horizon originally de-vendored its
javascript code. However, Horizon didn't appear to use it even then
in the Juno release and has not used it since.

Change-Id: I84fd8484cd6f7f20a86e4a5c7a496c6f32f86e88

commit_message:
Update status of members from Haproxy statistics

Member's operating status is not reflecting actual state.
For example, when the VM is is in shutdown state,
it's operating status is shown as ONLINE.

Haproxy statistics will have the current status of the servers.
Use this info to update the operating status of members.
Then user can get the operating status of members through statuses[1] Rest API.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/API_2.0#Retrieve_a_specific_Load_Balancer.27s_Status_Tree

Closes-bug: #1464229
Change-Id: I5a2039b754583bfc4d73fc16dd66cae1eeb3af74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/27/215027/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sixfrom neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer import constants as lb_const # update members status if stats.get('members'): self.update_members_operating_status(context, stats['members']) def update_members_operating_status(self, context, members): """Update members operating status from HAProxy statistics. HAProxy statistics also contain the current status of the servers. Update member's operating status from this current status. We don't update the current status when the member is DEGRADED or DISABLED. """ for mem_id, health_check in six.iteritems(members): status = lb_const.ONLINE # should we also check below condition # i.e status of last health check? # if health_check['health'] in ['L4OK', 'L6OK', 'L7OK', 'L7OKC'] if health_check['status'] != constants.ACTIVE: status = lb_const.OFFLINE mem = self.plugin.db.get_pool_member(context, mem_id) if mem.operating_status not in [lb_const.DEGRADED, lb_const.DISABLED]: self.plugin.db.update_status(context, db_models.MemberV2, mem_id, operating_status=status)

commit_message:
ServiceGroup Refactoring: Add is_up to Service Obj

Add is_up method to Service object. Also remove ReadOnlyDict from
host_manager module and pass service object. This is needed in compute
filter so that host_passes method can extract service and invoke
is_up to check if the service is up or not. The new method, 'is_up',
introduced will check RPC liveness as well as servicegroup API's
service_is_up method to make sure that service is alive.

Change-Id: If792674de28c61bda6abf7230e7a7c5909567e05
Partially-Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane

commit_message:
Distinguish no existed columns in ShowOne

If we show a resource with no existed column, ShowOne command
don't raise any warning and notify that we are doing some
wrong things, the suitable behavior should be like as Lister
command, output the no recognized column names.

Change-Id: I5a698653a683c00dd3e3e41c3b381f3d4dac2c08
Closes-Bug: #1548701

subject: Servicegroup Foundational Refactoring
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 00:23:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b3c9c25d9f597685d205b57589f693e06a91ea63', 'message': 'WIP : Servicegroup Foundational Refactoring

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data
can  be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), etc. Every interface relies on the servicegroup
layer API is_up() to get details about service live-ness. The proposal
is keep service data in nova database nova.services table and fetch
the live-ness information from the configured servicegroup(SG) driver.
Liveness will be a combination of service live-ness and RPC live-ness,
where the later will be computed based on information in nova.services.

Change-Id: I8d9aaa02b91418b64d3d8a168095d274d2e66f8b
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane

commit_message:
Servicegroup Foundational Refactoring

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data
can  be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), etc. Every interface relies on the servicegroup
layer API is_up() to get details about service live-ness. The proposal
is keep service data in nova database nova.services table and fetch
the live-ness information from the configured servicegroup(SG) driver.
Liveness will be a combination of service live-ness and RPC live-ness,
where the later will be computed based on information in nova.services.

Change-Id: I8d9aaa02b91418b64d3d8a168095d274d2e66f8b
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane

commit_message:
api-ref: parameter validation for os-security-group-rules

Cleans up a bunch of the types and descriptions for the
parameters.

Removes some extraneous unused parameters.

Added descriptions for the request and response to point out
that group_id and cidr are optional but one or the other is
required and depending on what comes in the request influences
what comes back in the response.

Part of blueprint api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I1084fa7ec46373cc989d1d93bb667ac59a62e38a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/315126/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Creates a rule for a security group. Either ``cidr`` or ``group_id`` must be specified when creating a rule. - cidr: secgroup_rule_cidrThe ``group`` is empty if ``group_id`` was not provided on the request. The ``ip_range`` is empty if ``cidr`` was not provided on the request. - ip_range: secgroup_rule_ip_range - cidr: secgroup_rule_cidr - id: secgroup_rule_id - tenant_id: secgroup_tenant_id_body
deleted_lines: .. needs:parameter_verificationCreates a rule for a security group. - cidr: cidr - ip_range: ip_range - cidr: cidr - id: id

commit_message:
Lift too strict restrictions on cross-deps role name

  Allow a user to specify any arbitrary string
  as role name for cross-deps that could be
  a regexp or a TASK_ROLE_PATTERN string

  Log a warning when task is not assigned
  to roles/groups/fields

  Set default logging level to INFO

Change-Id: I42c2490cf22f53892a189165698d1acd56ee4c74
Closes-bug: #1557997

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import re from sre_constants import error as sre_error import jsonschema import six from fuel_plugin_builder import errors class FormatChecker(jsonschema.FormatChecker): def __init__(self, role_patterns=(), *args, **kwargs): super(FormatChecker, self).__init__() @self.checks('fuel_task_role_format') def _validate_role(instance): sre_msg = None if isinstance(instance, six.string_types): if instance.startswith('/') and instance.endswith('/'): try: if re.compile(instance[1:-1]): return True except sre_error as e: sre_msg = str(e) else: for role_pattern in role_patterns: if re.match(role_pattern, instance): return True err_msg = "Role field should be either a valid " \ "regexp enclosed by " \ "slashes or a string of '{0}' or an " \ "array of those. " \ "Got '{1}' instead.".format(", ".join(role_patterns), instance) if sre_msg: err_msg += "SRE error: \"{0}\"".format(sre_msg) raise errors.TaskFieldError(err_msg)

commit_message:
Revert "allow to configure my_ip parameter"

This has broken TripleO. There is a patch[1] up to update TripleO,
but it does much more than just configure my_ip via the Puppet
module, and there is no confirmation that it has even been tested
since we can't get far enough to actually exercise Ironic to do a
deployment in CI.

[1] Ibaa55b2d4264b07faeb307893ef746ed0eb1df0c

Partial-Bug: 1581479
This reverts commit 05d474c3b219af82dcdfab7bb6bd2a6c0e6cdbcc.

Change-Id: I1db1baf6506d22c29a4e25fbe574e3df8578cb72

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/99/312799/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # For Mitaka, I18n team translates install guide and networking guide. # To minimize the translatin resource, generate pot from install guide only. # networking guide does not use common files that is not used by install guide. # However, use common process to keep current translation process. # Do not generate common-rst from the whole common-rst directory. # common-rst.pot is generated by install guide build process. exit 0 #DIRECTORY="doc/common-work" #TOPDIR="doc/" #mkdir -p $DIRECTORY/source #cp doc/common/source/conf.py $DIRECTORY/source/conf.py #ln -sf ../../common $DIRECTORY/source/common #cat <<EOF > $DIRECTORY/source/index.rst #.. toctree:: # :maxdepth: 2 # :glob: # # common/* #EOF # Do not come here, exit at the above block. # dummy method to avoid syntax error exit 0 #msgcat ${DIRECTORY}/source/locale/common.pot | \ # awk '$0 !~ /^\# [a-z0-9]+$/' \ # > ${TOPDIR}common/source/locale/common.pot #rm -rf $DIRECTORY # save common.pot as common to translate mv -f ${DIRECTORY}/source/locale/common.pot \ ${TOPDIR}common/source/locale/common.pot
deleted_lines: DIRECTORY="doc/common-work" TOPDIR="doc/" mkdir -p $DIRECTORY/source cp doc/common/source/conf.py $DIRECTORY/source/conf.py ln -sf ../../common $DIRECTORY/source/common cat <<EOF > $DIRECTORY/source/index.rst .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 2 :glob: common/* EOF msgcat ${DIRECTORY}/source/locale/common.pot | \ awk '$0 !~ /^\# [a-z0-9]+$/' \ > ${TOPDIR}common/source/locale/common.pot rm -rf $DIRECTORY

commit_message:
Get support matrix notes from the ini file

Currently the notes at the bottom of the support matrix are hardcoded.
This patch reads these out of the ini file to make this extension easier
to re-use in other parts of the docs.

Related to blueprint feature-classification

Change-Id: I0b2c8fbf18dd6f763cc173ff9fbabe90cbed7e0b

commit_message:
default swift_url to SERVICE_DEFAULT

If swift_url is unset, Trove will set it using the Keystone catalog.
Therefore we will default the swift_url setting to use SERVICE_DEFAULT,
so that out of the box configs will use the Keystone catalog.

Change-Id: I7a3fe361ca41fbee9f353be6e2306c1a5c7f7097
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove refs/changes/08/314408/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with swift intentionally unset' do let :pre_condition do "class { 'trove': nova_proxy_admin_pass => 'verysecrete'}" end let :params do { :swift_url => false } end it 'configures trove-guestagent without swift_url custom parameters' do is_expected.to contain_trove_guestagent_config('DEFAULT/swift_url').with_ensure('absent') end end

commit_message:
Mend deleted_nodes task(s)

Change yaql expr to trigger only if delete event is occur.
Get fqdn data from network_metadata source as well.

Change-Id: I35081ae57502905382045953cba16dd39c39d585
Closes-Bug: #1581436

commit_message:
Add a summary of the architecture evolution work

This adds a new section describing some of the key ares we are currently
working on. Probably more importantly, it also lists the areas that we
know need attention, but currently don't have a clear plan.

Change-Id: I42f0c0056c8a35fdc54cbc119c80f934f1ee57c7

commit_message:
docs: split up upgrade and upgrade futures

We need better docs that look more widely at how our upgrades work,
and what promises we make to our users.

This needs to be separate from our more future direction document that
looks at some of the ways we are trying to move upgrades forward.

Change-Id: Ice72e8c508a2206cada31d8d7c9f574f09d5eeb4

commit_message:
[sahara] remove sahara-tests from projects.txt

sahara-tests is using independent release scheme now.
so, disable sync of requirements for sahara-tests.

Change-Id: I9eeecb9b5acfdef6d91fe7bb7ccafd6796a60cee
